result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald I. Haefner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cred. Fraud-Use to Defraud>$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(b).
  • Credit Fraud-Use to Defraud (>$10,000) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(b).
  • Credit Fraud-Use to Defraud (>$10,000) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(b).
  • Credit Fraud-Use to Defraud (>$10,000) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(b).
  • Credit Fraud-Use to Defraud (>$10,000) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$10,000, Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$10,000, Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$10,000, Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$10,000, Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
This prison sentence to commence forthwith.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program nor the Substance Abuse Program.
Counts 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 - 14, 16 -18, 20 - 39, 41 - 57, 59 - 63 dismissed and read in.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant to submit to a DNA swab and pay the surcharge of $250.00.  
DOC shall withhold inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution.  The balance due shall be a condition of extended supervision/parole.  If discharged with financial obligations owing, a civil judgment shall be entered and/or other collection procedures will be implemented.
Defendant to have no contact with Ripon College or their staff.
The $250,000.00 bond to be forwarded to Travelers Insurance Company.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department Of Corrections.

Probation conditions are as ordered on Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Count 64.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented.  If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald I. Haefner
